Context: The George Brown College's Early Childhood Education (Accelerated) (C160) program is a 16-month continuous diploma program starting from September 2023 through December 2024. Students will learn how to support children as they grow, studying the physical, cognitive, social and emotional development stages of infants to school-aged children. The tuition grant for domestic students is $2,000. Some clinical or work placement partners may require students to show proof of full vaccination against COVID-19. There's also a fast-track program (C130) available for those with a diploma or degree in a related field. The funding for this opportunity comes from the City of Toronto, the Region of Durham, the Region of Peel, the Province of Ontario, and the Government of Canada under the new Canada-Ontario Early Childhood Workforce Agreement.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Early Childhood Education Program (Accelerated) C160 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The text provides information about an Accelerated Early Childhood Education (ECE) Diploma program offered at George Brown College. Here are the key factual points extracted from the text:

- The program consists of alternating blocks of classroom theory and field practice.
- Students complete a seven-week field placement in each semester.
- George Brown operates Ontario's largest network of school-run child care centres, with 12 locations across the Greater Toronto Area (GTA).
- Graduates may find employment in various settings such as child care centres, early years centres, full-day kindergarten, parent resource centres, pediatric playrooms, special education settings, integrated kindergartens, therapeutic nursery programs, and in-home care.
- Successful completion of the ECE Diploma program makes students eligible for entrance to Ontario's College of Early Childhood Educators as a Registered Early Childhood Educator.
- Students with a GPA of 2.50 or higher may apply to complete bridge courses for entry into the third year of George Brown's Honours Bachelor of Early Childhood Leadership (Degree Completion) program.
- A George Brown ECE diploma will also give students credit toward degree programs at other institutions.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Early Childhood Education Program (Accelerated) C160 | George Brown College2023.txt

The text provides information on required courses for a degree program in Early Childhood Education (ECE) at the college. Each semester's course list includes the respective codes and names of the courses. Here is an extract of factual information from the given text:

- Semesters 1 to 4 are outlined with their respective courses.

- Students might need to take COMM 1000 before progressing to COMM 2000.

Courses for Semester 1:
- ECE 1000: Professional Development Workshop 1
- ECE 1069: Health, Safety and Nutrition

- ...

- ...

- ECE 1080: Professional Development Workshop 2

- ECE 2049: Inclusion In Early Childhood
- ECE 2050: Working with Families
- ECE 2053: Curriculum Theory
- ...

Additionally, students may be required to take COMM 1000 as a prerequisite for COMM 2000. This course does not count towards graduation and will incur extra charges.

Context:
International Tuition:
- For programs starting in Fall 2022: $26,060.00 (for the first three semesters)
- For programs starting in Fall 2023 and later: Amounts are subject to change

Additional costs:
- Total of tuition, materials, student service and ancillary fees for the first three semesters

Financial Assistance:
- Approved for OSAP funding for applicants who meet eligibility criteria

Admission Requirements:
- Applicants selected based on academic achievement and other selection criteria
- Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent, grade 12 English (C or U), and additional grade 12 C, U, M or grade 11 C, U or M credits required
- Mature students may take Admissions Assessment for English or consider upgrading to achieve English credit(s)
- Program is delivered in consecutive semesters from September 2023 to December 2024
- College or university credits may qualify for course exemptions

International Students:
- More information regarding international fees and related costs available on the International Fees and Related Costs page
- Information regarding country-specific admission requirements available on the International Admissions page.

Special Requirements:
- Field placement is a mandatory component of the program, accommodation issues may be addressed with an Accessible Learning Consultant.

Context:
The Early Childhood Education (ECE) program at George Brown College has certain requirements for students before beginning field placement. These requirements include completing a Standard First Aid with CPR level C course, obtaining a Police Vulnerable Sector Check, and undergoing medical clearance. Students who cannot provide completed field clearance documents may not be able to complete their field placement and the program.

Public Health recommends that students working with young children be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Students who are not fully vaccinated against COVID-19 may not be able to complete the required field placement component of their program in the regularly scheduled time frame.

Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges, while international students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System. For more information on the ECE field placement requirements, applicants can email ece@georgebrown.ca.

The contact details for the School of Early Childhood are as follows:
Phone: 416-415-5000, ext. 2310
Email: ece@georgebrown.ca
Office hours: 8 a.m. â€“ 5 p.m.

George Brown College offers related programs such as Early Childhood Education (C100), Early Childhood Education (Fast-Track) (C130), and Early Childhood Education (Consecutive Diploma/Degree) (C118). For more information or to book a campus tour, visit the college website.
